intro: Anamorpha melochiodes, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly honeyeaters.
